programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Orange You Glad Dan Sold It Again?
programme.desc: At an auction in Burbank, California, a new buyer challenges both Barry and Jarrod - and ends up buying a locker that is packed full of surprises.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys get involved in a dispute with a former employee over a 1968 Corvette Stingray, before Allen Haff tests his ninja skills with an antique weapon.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones are out-contested by a glamorous duo, but a rash bid on some apparent trash leads to an unexpected outcome. Meanwhile, a punt on an ancient artifact is considered.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor sets his sights on a scooter that could be worth 3,000 dollars, and Lesa spots a snake-skin ensemble.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers bid for some scruffy looking lockers, but appearances prove deceptive as the most unattractive units turn out to contain the most valuable contents.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank look for old arcade games during a power cut. They also come across a collection of motorbikes, but realise they may not be for sale.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: One of the swampers suffers an injury that puts him out of action for the rest of the season. Partnerships start to crack under the pressure as the year's hunting draws to a close.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The crew's rescuing abilities are tested when a mail truck falls down a ravine. Plus, mounting bills force boss Jamie to sack members of his team.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine some vintage artwork from a Spider-Man comic-book, a piece of the Apollo 13 rocket, and a classic motorcycle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers get the chance to buy a re-creation of the Batmobile from Tim Burton's Batman movies, a spy's desk, and a letter signed by Thomas Jefferson and James Madison.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: Jon is joined by Joe Wilkinson, Lucy Beaumont and Kiri Pritchard-McLean to address worries to do with The Self. Has Joe fallen in with a bad crowd?.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic long jump champion Greg Rutherford, broadcaster Kirsty Young, actress-writer Joanna Scanlan and comedian Henning Wehn join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig and Alan Davies are joined by Josh Widdicombe, Susan Calman and Matt Lucas for this extended edition of the long-running panel show - and this week it's a festive special, so Sandi's elves have been busy coming up with tough questions on the subject of - what else? - Noel. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers considered to be most interesting.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Broadcaster and writer Danny Baker, comedian Aisling Bea, Peep Show star Robert Webb and historian Kate Williams join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister loses Rimmer in a game of poker to a group of biologically engineered life forms, while Kryten and Cat become quantum entangled and do everything in perfect unison. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle revisit the best moments from the series' 11 stunts, the biggest wins and losses and there are even some previously unseen moments.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Vajont Dam in the mountains of northern Italy, and the catastrophic flood in 1963 that caused the deaths of 2000 people.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in South West France, which is the tallest bridge in the world and stretches two and a half kilometres over one of Europe's deepest valleys.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson explores the history of the ancient kingdom on a walk from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of Northumbria's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Albert Victor: The Prince and the Ripper
programme.desc: Sordid speculation dogged the life of Prince Albert Victor, who was even a suspect in the Jack the Ripper case.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: A profile of Dudley Mason, who was awarded the George Cross after the tanker he was commanding came under attack during Operation Pedestal in August 1942 to relieve Malta.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Vajont Dam in the mountains of northern Italy, and the catastrophic flood in 1963 that caused the deaths of 2000 people.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He test drives some of the vehicles Germany and Japan produced during the post-war period, as well as an assortment of other classic cars, including E-Types and Mustangs. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: An observation of the wildlife that inhabits the narrow band of mountains and rainforest on the island's east coast, from ring-tailed lemurs living on an inhospitable peak, to forest-dwelling sifakas, small primates on the verge of extinction. The programme also focuses on the golden bamboo lemur, which is capable of consuming daily doses of cyanide, and looks at the fruit-rich treetops where red-ruffed lemurs defend their food and territory. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A colossal American football stadium in Texas, that features the world's largest retractable roof and is able to seat over 100,000 spectators with no restricted viewpoints.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Hidden tunnels that saw a city prosper, a sunken wreck with a remarkable past, a concrete wartime dome and a mysterious Cold War building.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: This edition examines the efforts of the British and Canadians who fought elite German divisions to capture the city of Caen, the key to breaking out of Normandy.

programme.title: Holocaust Escape Tunnel
programme.desc: Archaeologists search for a rumoured escape route from a Nazi execution site in Poland that led to a nearby Synagogue, which was later destroyed by the Soviet army.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind an abandoned Second World War aviation facility in Farnborough, a Soviet airbase in the Gobi Desert, and a disused furnace in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When Eve finds evidence implicating her boyfriend, aid-worker Stefan, in murder, Boyd promises to support her and help get to the bottom of the mystery. But when it turns out her lover may also be involved in people smuggling, the pathologist becomes determined to prove his innocence, bringing her into conflict with her boss. Joseph Mawle guest stars, with Tara FitzGerald and Trevor Eve.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra is reunited with an old flame when DCI Larson of the Met's arts and antiques squad asks her to look into the murder of an antiques dealer who was not quite as legitimate as everyone thought. Brian is puzzled by Esther's odd behaviour and her new-found interest in the internet, leading him to think the unthinkable - she must be having an affair. Paul McGann and Jesse Birdsall guest star, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam learns the Borough Commander has been sent photos of him smoking marijuana, and decides to resign before he's unceremoniously thrown off the force. Rochelle continues her steamy illicit affair with Dan, while Jack questions Neil about his relationship with Suzie Sim and receives a bland assurance that it's all professional and above board - but later sees the pair in a compromising position.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Nick mounts a vigil at the unconscious Ariadne's bedside, while Hallam and George risk their necks to rescue a youngster trapped in the bedroom of a blazing house.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Winsford Walled Garden in Devon, to answer the owner's horticultural queries.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Anna is relieved when Gino believes she miscarried, and they spend the night together in the cottage before telling their families of their intention to marry. James sees a psychiatrist who agrees to treat his sexuality, Elizabeth worries that Regina is getting closer to discovering the truth about Sarah's past, and Jack is stunned to learn that he is Anna's father. However, a bigger shock is in store for those at Ash Park when a body is found in the river. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: An elderly Sarah reveals the truth about Bert Ford's death. Meanwhile in 1953, Sarah and Anna start their trial periods in their new homes, and Jack is furious at Carolyn for having kept their daughter a secret. Olivia becomes concerned over James's brutal hospital treatment and Elizabeth makes a shock announcement. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam learns the Borough Commander has been sent photos of him smoking marijuana, and decides to resign before he's unceremoniously thrown off the force. Rochelle continues her steamy illicit affair with Dan, while Jack questions Neil about his relationship with Suzie Sim and receives a bland assurance that it's all professional and above board - but later sees the pair in a compromising position.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Nick rushes an operation so he can deal with a more glamorous case - a pole dancer with a rare condition - and impress Connie. However, his plan backfires and leaves him facing accusations of negligence. Donna finds out Justin went to a strip club when he said he was at his mother's, and Joseph treats a man who may have brain damage - an experience that brings back painful memories.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max's day gets off to a celebratory start as he and Amanda announce their engagement, but he soon gets into trouble with his blushing bride-to-be when she discovers he's been secretly giving methadone to a heroin-overdose victim. Charlie and Jan fail to keep their personal and professional lives separate when they fall out over security arrangements, and a circulating e-mail soon outs their closet affair to the rest of Holby A&E. Robert Gwilym and Derek Thompson star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack takes over as superintendent in Adam's absence, and promotes Neil Manson to acting DCI - despite grave misgivings about his recent conduct. Gabriel publicly asks Sheelagh out for dinner, allaying her fears that their relationship is over, and Ramani is devastated to learn Terry has been having an affair with his sister-in-law. Affairs of the heart also preoccupy Dan Casper, who receives another poison pen letter - but decides to ignore it and continue his affair with Rochelle.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: It's Arthur's 50th birthday and Pauline is busy preparing for the celebrations but Mrs Hewitt feels left out. Cindy and Hattie have a massive argument.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mrs Hewitt has given Arthur an ultimatum, he needs to tell Pauline he is leaving her today but Martin is ill. Nick asks Dot to move in with him and his family.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A grieving Nick struggles to come to terms with Ariadne's tragic death, while a raging timber-yard fire has serious consequences for Billy.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Lexie is furious that Dorothy has taken over the island in the middle of the loch for her latest business venture - a tai chi retreat - and enlists Golly to sabotage the scheme. Molly struggles to put her break-up behind her, and Paul is roped into the housework. Dawn Steele stars.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Jess fears she may be pregnant and Karen nervously prepares for a visit by one of David's old flames, the glamorous Evelyn Parrish. Joe makes a clumsy attempt to seduce Anna's nanny and winds up with egg on his face, while Kath is discovered unconscious and rushed into hospital, putting everyone else's problems into perspective.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Leonora announces she is pregnant, Lilo Lil brings Nellie news of Freddie's whereabouts, and Grandad dreams about his funeral. Last-ever episode of Carla Lane's sitcom.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Tyler and Marlene are not impressed by their new surroundings and want a swift return to Peckham, but Boycie warms to the idea of becoming a 'gentleman farmer', which seemingly involves doing little work and mingling with the country set. His manager Elgin persuades him to retain all his staff.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel suffers embarrassment when he walks in on Sandy in the bath, and once the sniggers subside Jean decides to have a second bathroom installed and calls in the builders. As the tension increases, she realises a minor incident has been turned into a major issue that she can ill afford.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio take a holiday at the seaside with Compo's miserable nephew Gordon, and attempt to cheer him up. Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde, Bill Owen and Philip Jackson star.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates when the new wife of Sir Raleigh is found dead in a locked room after seeing an Egyptian mummy. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Despite being housebound as he recovers from his injuries, Blake investigates the death of a teenage girl in the dressing room at the debutante ball.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the mystery of a missing scientist, after the man's wife receives a series of emails from someone claiming to know what happened to him. The physics professor was last seen in 2004, on a train to Paris for a conference, and when he disappeared he was working on a potentially lucrative cold fusion project that had attracted attention from many large organisations. However, as the detectives dig deeper, a shadowy Whitehall figure warns Sandra's boss Strickland they should drop the case.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Old adversary Linda Cummings taunts Boyd from inside a secure psychiatric hospital, leading the team to discover more murder victims within its confines. As his frustrations rise, Boyd needs help from Grace - but she has been mysteriously forced to take time away from the Cold Case Squad and handed the investigation over to an eminent psychologist who is an expert on Cummings. Guest starring Gina McKee, Ruth Gemmell and Alexander Siddiq.

programme.title: Stuck on You: The Football Sticker Story
programme.desc: How four Italian brothers took a childhood obsession and turned it into a worldwide multi-billion pound industry - and the British upstarts who took on the mighty Panini to beat them at their own game.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: As Britain and Europe remain locked down in the fight against Covid-19, Julie Etchingham asks how seriously the food supply chain is being affected. Crops will be ready to be harvested in the coming weeks, but there may be no labour available. She looks at how shops, supermarkets and delivery services are coping now the early panic buying is over. And she asks, if vulnerable families cannot get access to food at prices they can afford, will people ultimately be forced to change the way they eat?.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic with Lorraine Kelly, including medical advice and stories of how people are coping with the lockdown.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Ruth Langsford, Coleen Nolan, Janet Street-Porter, and Gloria Hunniford are joined by guests fashion designer Pearl Lowe and comedian Leigh Francis.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: In Northern Ireland, James and local boy Paul Rankin brave the Carrick-a-Rede rope bridge together, then James cooks a tasty fish dish with the dramatic coastline as his backdrop. There's a fishing trip over to Rathlin Island on the menu too, where James tastes some dishes made from the local kelp. The duo then visit the Old Lammas Fair, where they taste some of the delicious seafood, before James cooks up a delicious boozy sweet treat using some of Ireland's tastiest liquor.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.sub-title: Oche Oche Oche, Oi Oi Oi!
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which A family of five with a shared love of darts answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Vanessa asks a big question of Charity, but the answer fails to help the situation, while Billy suggests to Dawn that she reaches out to Manpreet for some support. Will hears that Carol and Ted's visit upset Dawn, and Belle is horrified to realise that her salon appointment is at the same time as Andrea's.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Asha implores Dev not to go to the police about the video, while Gary finds Kelly in tears and is startled to learn she was thrown out of school. Geoff engineers a row between Yasmeen and Cathy after reading a pamphlet on domestic abuse with a list of signs of controlling behaviour.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Young physiotherapist Lizzie Faulkner is shot dead while enjoying a holiday at a luxury country retreat. The resulting murder investigation unearths betrayal, guilt and the desire for atonement - as Vera moves quickly to avoid another tragedy, and Joe tries to make amends with the demons of his past. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Paul Ritter and Eva Quinn.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson finds himself on the opposite side of the talk show format, as he discusses his life and career with Piers Morgan. The veteran host looks back on his encounters with some of the world's biggest stars, including Fred Astaire and Madonna, as well as what is perhaps his most famous moment, a powerful series of interviews with Muhammad Ali. He also reflects on his roots in a Yorkshire mining village, the death of his father, and his struggle with alcohol and the impact it had on his otherwise successful 60-year marriage.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, in which a team of five answer questions about top 10 lists then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Will they have what it takes to head home with the 125,000 cash?.

programme.title: The Showdown: Calvin Vs Sigala

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Find out how they make military helicopters, how they design metro systems and how they engineer artificial reefs.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton and ex-Para Freddy head to Russia, finding some of Moscow's biggest military dealers. Back home, the twins restore a rare German engine starter.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The PJD crew is flooded with customers following success at the Sturgis rally, and Paul Sr has to decide whether to attend his son's wedding.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Ken Cage and Danny Thompson repossess a tour bus, Kevin Lacey faces armed guards, and Mike Kennedy is caught in a gun-smuggling operation.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe climbs date palms in order to pollinate them. The intrepid presenter also cuts granite and visits a gun range.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Aluminum Canoes/Wooden Stave Bowls/Wheelchair Accessible Vans/Marimbas
programme.desc: A look at how aluminium canoes, wooden stave bowls, wheelchair accessible vans and marimbas are made.

programme.title: How It's Made

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into the life-saving science behind crash-testing cars. Plus, how expensive Dutch tableware is made, and the process of making hand-made, pocket-sized umbrellas.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard visits Britain's oldest number plate maker. Plus, Paul and Drew disagree about adding a mega engine onto a tiny Italian classic..

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: News of Captain Phil's death reaches the fleet as the boats battle one last storm to finish the season, and the crews vow to celebrate his life.

programme.title: Trawler Wars
programme.desc: After six months undergoing repairs, the Filadelphia heads out to sea, but, as a storm closes in, the engine fails and the crew has to send out a distress call to the coastguard.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer purchases a Mini Moke, which was designed as an off-road military vehicle, for expert mechanic Edd China to work on - before trying to sell it for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and mechanic Edd China sets about mending it. They then take the car to Exmoor for a final test drive before looking for a buyer.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne's found perfect multimillion dollar cars for two new clients - a rare BMW 507 and a 275 GTB/4 Ferrari and he's taking the Ferrari to the race track.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Just outside Philadelphia is a pair of mint Jaguars with Wayne's name on them. A blue 1958 XK 150S and a 1961 JXKE roadster, the 160th car built.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini criss-crosses New Jersey finding a Corvette, a Ferrari Dino and bringing a rare electric Fisker Supercar and a one-off super-stretch Mercedes limo to auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne rescues a 1923 Rolls-Royce Silver Cloud Touring Car that has seen one too many cold New Hampshire winters.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland travel to the Isle of Wight where they test out an '80s Ford sportscar. Plus, they get a taste of Hollywood glamour behind the wheel of a legendary Alfa Romeo.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: In the West Country, Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove discover sheds full of classic bikes, vintage cars and extraordinary limousines, including one owned by Eva Peron, one-time wife of the Argentine President Juan Peron.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove visit a fanatical biker in Yorkshire, who has the biggest collection of motorcycles they've seen so far.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to a Martello Tower on the Channel Islands. Meanwhile, the twins are tasked to get a Second World War Napalm filled flamethrower ready for a buyer.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a quirky house in Suffolk, to discover a barn full of salvage from around the globe.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Sculptor Nick has his skills stretched by an equestrian piece with classical connections. Plus, leather expert Martin works on a piece of luggage once owned by Russian royalty.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer manages to find an inexpensive MGB GT in urgent need of repair and enlists the help of mechanic Edd China to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The MGB GT restoration continues as Mike Brewer and Edd China do their utmost to get the classic car back on the road.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: iDrew Pritchard hts the road with upholsterer Craig. In Derbyshire a 15th-century house has some Victorian dining chairs with potential, and the duo also visit an antique centre in Lincolnshire.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits one of his favourite houses and discovers a design classic, and later visits a museum in a giant windmill.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Darrell and the team head to a mysterious island where they discover valuable clues that lead them closer in the hunt to a 500-year-old shipwreck.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: The final member of Farley Dean's gold-mining crew arrives on Bougainville Island, but a reckless decision by Farley divides the crew and jeopardises the mission.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Cameras head underground into America's largest mine to find out how lead is extracted. Plus, how made-to-measure shotguns are manufactured.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technological processes involved in manufacturing peanut butter, and how domestic appliances are tested.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: Pensacola Police investigate the disappearance of popular news reporter Sean Dugas, and find themselves drawn into an addictive world of gaming. Meanwhile, across state a mother vanishes after a family party and a neighbour's CCTV reveals a shocking tale of murder and betrayal.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of serial killer Jo Dennehy reveal how her shocking crimes impacted the family. Were there any signs of her murderous intentions?.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of serial killer Robert Maudsley reveal how his shocking crimes impacted the family. Were there any signs of his murderous intentions?.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of Steve Wright, the so-called Suffolk Strangler, reveal how his shocking crimes impacted the family. Were there any signs of his murderous intentions?.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a 14-year-old Regina Walters, believed to have run away from home with her boyfriend. A few months later, her body was recovered and the finger of suspicion eventually pointed to truck driver Robert Rhoades, whose vehicle contained a torture chamber in the back.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The Houston SPCA rescues two mistreated horses from a waterlogged paddock, and a golden retriever has a mysterious itch.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown gets hands-on with an angry alligator, a dehydrated puppy struggles, Lucky the cat swallows a large amount of human medication and a parrot is involved in a love triangle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The grooms take over the salon and the consultants know that when 'the man' is in the salon, he is the one who could be driving the appointment. All of which guarantees them an interesting shift.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Tensions run high between a bride and her demanding wedding planner, and the youngest sibling of a large family fights for her right to be heard and stands up to her sisters.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Two women compete to be named maid of honour, and a bride struggles to wrestle control of her big day from a groomsmaid intent on stealing the spotlight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride has dreamed about walking down the aisle in a dress with a detachable shirt since she was a little girl, and it falls to the team to make it happen.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer does not like being the centre of attention, while a bride makes a return visit to the shop with her far from supportive mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride spends $11,000 on a dress, then decides it needs some alterations, while another customer who has recently lost a lot of weight is excited to try on gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride is determined to outshine her sister, and a customer has a special visitor during her fitting.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney vet Dr Chris Brown attempts to help a lady who runs a shelter for abandoned donkeys. Lisa takes on a six-year-old apprentice who has arrived at Sash with her sick dog, Jelly.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown pays a visit to Kyabram Vet Clinic in the state of Victoria to lend a hand to an old friend.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Felipe Santos, who vanished in 2003 after police in Naples, Florida, caught him driving illegally. The investigation became more complicated a year later when Terrance Williams vanished from the same area in identical circumstances.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Allison Foy, who went missing in July 2006 after drinks with friends at a bar in North Carolina. Investigators contemplated whether the 34-year-old was trying to escape her stormy marriage or abducted by a predator. The mystery of her disappearance ended two years later when her remains were found in woodland close by the body of another murder victim, but no one was detained in connection with her death.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 42-year-old Patricia Viola, who vanished from her New Jersey home in February 2001, shortly after a routine telephone conversation with her mother. A bone fragment was found locally just over a year later, but it would be a another decade until DNA advancements allowed its identity to be positively confirmed after comparisons were made with samples provided by Viola's two children.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Vermont teenager Brianna Maitland, who vanished after leaving her family's farm after dropping out of high school, intent on getting her life back on track. Four days after the 17-year-old was last seen by friends in March 2004, her slightly damaged car was recovered from outside an abandoned farmhouse.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Despite a solid support network of her boyfriend and cousin, Tiffany finds it difficult to break the cycle of depressed eating when her two room-mates refuse to help her.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Marla, who is so heavy she cannot stand up. Bedridden, she must face facts about her health and the toll it takes on her family, who are doing what they can to help.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three lovers of all things vintage are given 800 euros to spend at a Paris market, in the hope of upcycling their goods and making a profit when they sell them at auction in York. John spends a large sum on an industrial lamp, while Mark turns a battered picture frame into a blackboard, and Agata transforms a sun lamp into a mirror.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan makes an offer on Susannah's silver tea set, and Ada's large bronze sculpture leaves him stumped. Meanwhile, at Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, owner Charlie finalises deals on an antique writing bureau and a diamond ring.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. A woman who has spent 10 years in bed turns to a doctor for help with losing weight, but may have left it too late to change.

programme.title: Criminal Confessions
programme.desc: Detectives question the ex-boyfriend of a woman who has gone missing in Houston.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: Melissa More adored her father and in her eyes, Keith Jeperson could do no wrong. However, as she got older, her love soon turned to fear of becoming his next victim.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the causes of two mystery deaths. Firstly, she is under pressure when a four-month-old boy dies - can she find out what killed him in time to safeguard his twin brother? Plus, the unexpected death of a young father needs to be investigated.
